reviews.text: If you call after 6pm this museum is free. During the day it is 10 euros. Depending on how much you like fine art take your choice. Very interesting, challenging and worth a look. Has small café and shop too. Great views of the outside.
A beautiful collection, thoughtfully and cleverly curated. Staff are kind and knowledgeable. Highly recommended! (I actually preferred it to the Guggenheim overall...)

The art here in general is beautiful. It's something the large majority of the population can enjoy, unlike the art at the more famous museum in the city. It used to be free on Wednesday for everyone, now there are some restrictions to the free entry. The museum also has a nice gift shop. The staff are usually helpful.
They were reorganizing and renovating the museum, but still, a very nice exhibit, good for a visit with only 2-3 hours available
My reason to be is few. My reason to be an artis is in a way thanks to this institution. so glad. so tender. Love deeply the Museo de Bellas artes de Bilbao

Interesting museum with some very good exhibits. Some of the informative videos can be played in English and there is also a useful app you can use to maximize your visit (bring headphones) I would recommend this museum to visitors to the City who want to understand a bit more of the history of Bilbao and how it’s roots are strongly set around a maritime history
Very nice little museum tucked out of the way.  Easy to miss.  It's worth seeing.
Fantastic museum over shadowed by the Guggenheim but we'll worth a visit. Do make the effort, the walk along the river is a bonus
Besides the Nervion riber. boats. Nice people from all over the World. love it
Wonderful experience seeing the maritime museum. The restaurant was fabulous too.
Un lugar entrañable de Bilbao. Muestra escasa pero bien presentada. Además puedes comprar dulces de diferentes conventos de España ,muy ricos y bien de precio.

Apunto a mi hija de 6 años a un curso de manualidades navideño que ofrece el Museo de Arte Sacro, por el cual cobran 4€ sin dar un recibo, ni ticket... A las 3 horas mi hija sale triste y llorosa porque la han tratado mal, la han llamado "chapucera" varias veces sin siquiera darse cuenta de que es zurda y le cuesta mas recortar con las tijeras normales. Siendo solamente 7 niños en el cursillo, reparten galletas entre los niños que no han llevado algo para picar, siendo mi hija la unica a la que no han dado nada...

Siendo un cursillo infantil y navideño dirigido a niños, que menos que tratarles bien y con cariño independientemente de si pintan y recortan un poco mejor o peor. Mas teniendo en cuenta que algunos niños son mas sensibles que otros.

He cometido el error de volver a fiarme de algo relacionado con la Iglesia, lo que mas siento es el mal rato que ha pasado mi hija de 6 años. No volvera a ocurrir, no contare nunca mas ni para lo mas minimo con nada relacionado con la Iglesia y por supuesto, jamas volveran a ver 1€ mio.
Dulces del convento de Navidad y Expo Belenes del Mundo, además de la colección permanente del Museo. Muy recomendable.
Merece la pena, si vas el lunes es entrada libre.
Uno de los museos que goza de más consideración es el de arte sacro. Los aficionados a los temas religiosos encuentra una buena gema donde ir a explorar. Sin duda muy recomendable.
Very beautiful structure with an interesting history. Definitely worth a quick stop in to see and dont miss the cloister outside! Also a 5€ adult ticket here gets you in at the other church too.

Iberia: One of the first lessons you must learn in Bilbao is ‘going for pintxos or tapas’. The tradition is similar in numerous Spanish cities, such as Granada, Salamanca and Madrid. But the ‘tapas’ from the Basque Country have a great reputation, gained from hard work and experimentation. You are bound to love them. Going for tapas in the Old Town is one of the best ways to get to know the old area of Bilbao, commonly referred to as the ‘seven streets zone’. We recommend starting your gastronomic itinerary at the bars surrounding St. James’ Cathedral, where you can easily lose track of time. This area is a mixture of terraces, bars and shops, all with a beautiful stone backdrop. End your route in the area around Unamuno Square and New Square, which are bursting with life both day and night. We recommend sampling the seafood specialities, such as the beloved dish of ‘rabas’ (calamari), and remember the saying: “one pintxo should be eaten in only three bites”.
Beautiful well-maintained cathedral in the heart of the old town. Not too crowded. It gets 5 stars because of the good audioguide.
Worth visiting. You get an audio guide and admission to nearby church is included.

Beautiful cathedral in the center of Bilbao but you have to pay to go in. You get an audio guide and entrance into another church. Very beautiful inside and there is a courtyard that you can go and see.
A beautiful place
A beautiful historic and emblematic place. A must see when visiting Bilbao.
Not

Hola. El sitio muy bonito, la basílica preciosa, pero no veo justo, k estén cerradas las Iglesias, no todo el mundo podemos ir a las horas k abren, se supone k es la casa d Dios, tenían k estar abiertas todo el día.
El fervor de los vizcaínos a su Amatxo es digno de admiración. Y el 15 de agosto es especialmente digno de ver.
Amazing
Makes a nice impression with the park in front

Bellísima!! Aunque ya la conocía de otros años, nunca había entrado, y cuál fue la sorpresa tan grande!! Por fuera es bastante sencilla, del 1600 - 1700 , por dentro es deslumbrante e imponente, muy buen conservada, merece más la pena entrar a verla con respeto y devoción y gratis que pagar los exagerados 5 euros de la catedral, de la que ya la conozco bastante bien y no tiene mucho que ofrecer.
El párroco ha sido muy amable y atento para resolver las consultas y preguntas
Para mí la iglesia más bonita de Bilbao. Y el entorno,  los jardines de Albia, aumentan su atractivo.
It worthy visiting. Fantastic building with great features. Library, gym, swimming pool and expositions are easy to visit

The building itself is a piece of art. Perfect place to study, lots of books. Theres a beautiful pool where you can swim for 7 euros. Sometimes there are some art expositions as well. You should go there and take a look!

Really interesting place for a lot of events and cultural relatable fields stay updated on their webpage about their last events and shows.
The swimming pool is more or less crowded at the peak times, so better not visit it at those busy times.
Meanwhile the solarium during the summer season is a must try in Bilbao, just to get tanned on the roofs of Bilbao on a historical building appeals me.

I was surprised as a tourist about this unique and wonderfully crafted building. If I were a resident of Bilbao I can just imagine how much impact a building like this can possibly have. We need more Azkuna Centers other cities! :D

A very nice place and in general has something for everybody. On rainy days lots of locals will take there kids there and let them run around. I like the cinema and the gym is one of if not the biggest gym in Bilbao. The library is a great place to sit and read and relax. The bar on the rooftop is very nice with spectacular views especially at night, obviously avoid it when it rains.
Monumental. Clásico. Céntrico.
El Instituto más céntrico de Bilbao además dan muy buena educación.
Magnifico edificio de Bilbao. Majestuoso.#rosafrancomendoza #LetsGuide
Fueron buenos cursos y se conoce a gente muy interesante.
Ok

bezocht als toerist in Bilbao en de voorgevel is fantastisch om te zien je kunt er alleen niet in zonder kaartje dus of de rest van het station net zo mooi is als de toeristen folders willen kan ik niet beoordelen voor de voorgevel alleen geeft vier sterren
Me encanta la vista de las calles a la orilla de la Ría(agua salada entrante del mar a la cd. De Bilbao.

Desangelada es la palabra que mejor la define, como casi todas las estaciones de vía estrecha del país. Precioso monumento histórico, pero el interior está tan reformado que apenas te deja ver el valor arquitectónico del edificio.

La cafetería de la estación es grande y sirven platos combinados y pintxos todo el día. La estación está bien acondicionada y aunque hay muchas máquinas para sacar billete, existe también la taquilla con el personal de FEVE que te atienden con gusto si vas a cualquier pueblo de Las Encartaciones, Santander o Asturias. Las frecuencias de trenes es buena.

VEry traditional place in Bilbao, also a very touristy place in Bilbao. It is a nice inner courtyard with plenty of small bars and restaurants all around. It is a good place both for a formal sit-down meal as well as for only a drink and a small snack.
This Plaza offers an amazing outdoor space surrounded by many cafés and restaurants. Though It was quiet and empty when I visited in March! Guess in summer it gets busy

İt is a historic and touristic plaza at the 1old town" part of Bilbao with full of selections restaurants,cafe and bars for a drink or food and souvenirs..You can enjoy your drink outside while enjoying the sun and the sorroundings..Prices are moderate  and plenty to choose from
lucky to be here in the miďle of a festival.  the atmosphere was electric and the locals were so kind...

Beautiful and most historic place of down town Bilbao.
A must visit area.

Good enough conference center overall. Acoustics are fine in almost every room. 

  But it's very easy to get lost in all those "Hogwarts like" stairs and easy to lost between very spreaded rooms.
  Also there was an escalator working toward bottom floor without any counter one working upwards and that's just ridiculous in my opinion.
Rustic building. The rusted iron clad wall, inspiring intriguing installations, great place to trek, walk, run.

Superb architecture, very wide spaces, amazing location.
The right place to take a meeting! (we were 1700 people during GSEF 2018 meeting in October)
Great auditorium. Very good sound due to design

I think the building needs some renovation, but still it works. The auditorium is impressive and it was a pleasure to listen to a concert there. It is a little hard to find your way due to the complex architecture.
Great park, workout equipment, a bit of a hike up - very steep, but amazing view at the top!
A placeto have so much fun i really enjoy my visit there
Great place .
The perfect place to have a walk and fun for kids
Beautiful view over Bilbao.

Per my friend this is a work of an artist/architect. The glass bottom was part of the beauty. The citizens of Bilbao refused to use the bridge because of the glass. The artist/architect refuse to budge. The mayor stated his responsibility was to the comfort & safety of the citizens of Bilbao. He ordered the glass covered up & the citizens started using it. 
The artist/architect sued the mayor and his name was removed from it.
nice looking bridge... but lots of stairs (and a ramp) to climb ... great views
I loved this place, above the Nervion river here in Bilbao, very quiet and calming place to take a walk.
A modern design bridge that has ramps as well as steps. Offers good views up and down the river. Close to the funicular railway.
Nice place to watch the world go by.
You can easily navigate your way around because its small and organized. We arrived here at 5am for our flight to Brussels. It was not busy and not much passengers.

Small and efficient airport. Everything is close. 
What cost 2 stars: a year ago, there were some local stores that had flair. Now it’s the global duty-free chain that is the same all over the world. Charm gone. Prices up - wonder anyway why people buy at these places, there’s nothing you cannot get cheaper at home...

Assisted passage always polite and efficient
  An easy airport to navigate.
A Beautiful airport by Calatrava. Altought the spaces could be a bit higher. And it doesnt have a bigger waiting area. Is very close from the city of bilbao.
Fantastic airport, getting form the outside to the gate takes 5 mins . New shops and bars have improved the experience a lot. Just need more destinations

Apenas vi por fora e tem uma arquitectura muito bonita.
Aproveitem para visiatr a cidade.

Club de fútbol de Bilbao inimitable, inigualable.....como dice la canción es más que un club de fútbol es un sentimiento que inunda Bilbao, Bizkaia... llenando de alegría y orgullo el corazón de sus seguidores y de admiración por su historio y el sentimiento que despierta en sus rivales....

Qué voy yo a decir, del edificio Ibaigane, la sede del mejor club de fútbol del universo,del Athletic club de Bilbao. Un edificio elegante por fuera y por dentro,rodeado de jardines, muy bien cuidados. Edificio historico de Bilbao, situado en  una zona preciosa de Bilbao. Poco más qué decir.
auténtico. para los futboleros
Un lugar emblemático en elbcentro de Bilbao
A nursing home next to a beautiful Park

Ahora es una residencia de ancianos . Tiene un parque fantástico para pasear y disfrutar y tiene una capilla preciosa y está en la mayor zona bonita de Bilbao . La Misericordia ha sido un referente en la vida del  Bilbao de hace muchos muchos años y entonces recogían y atendían a niños huérfanos o necesitados y les daban cobijo y educación ,Aleluya!!!

Mi experiencias es d 8 años disfrutando del interior , Los años 60 .Ahora como exalugno disfruto el dia q celebramos San mames con mis antiguos compañeros en el jardin celebrando una misa en compañia d los jubilados q estan excelentemente atendidos.Y publico en general
Bona residència per a gent gran o dependents.

hola soy un chicho que estuve en la misericordia entre los años 1978 al 1987.mi nombre es jose luis larrea,me gustaria saber como podria ponerme en contacto con gente que estuvo conmigo,si existe alguna pagina o algo,un saludo y gracias
Una maravilla de tienda y maravillosas las dependientas.PRECIOSA tienda  Y FANTASTICAS DEPENDIENTAS.

Had eaten there last year on 2 separate occasions it was that good. Once again it did not disappoint. Located in the old town. Brought a group of 8 and all agreed it was terrific value. Great food with a twist. Very friendly service. Great menu with something for everyone. Cowboy steak for 2 is amazing.
Amazingly succulent iberic pork cheeks!

Very sweet and quiet place. The vegan croquettes are delicious and so is the pickeld fried tofu tartare. Desserts are a bit disappointing. A familial and not so touristy restaurant. Ideal for an upscale night in Bilbao if you have had your dose of pinchos!
Had a lovely afternoon meal here  really nice food and very friendly helpfully staff.  Great value for money - definitely recommend

Great weekend menu. Delicious food, friendly staff, quick service. Both courses, the dessert and the wine were great. A nice spot in the old district if you’re looking for a place to eat well and not break the bank

We have been to this place twice. First about 3 years ago and second time last October. First time I would rate 5* and second time just 1*, as a result average score is 3*. I very much hope that they will get back to the quality they had. It was simply a perfect lunch first time !
Friendly staff, delicious and abundant local food with fresh ingredients at reasonable prices.

A friend and I had lunch here a few months ago. We made reservations for 1:00pm when the kitchen opened, and after an hour my friend had to leave to make an appointment. I had a bit of my dessert left and decided to stay 5 minutes after she left to finish. A few minutes after she left our waiter came up to me at the table and told me I would have to leave soon to free the table. I agreed, but no less than two minutes later a different man came up to me and told me I had to go that moment. I left before finishing my food, less than an hour and a half after we had arrived. I was flustered, embarrassed, and in shock at being kicked out of a restaurant despite having a reservation and staying within a reasonable timeframe. I understand that they're a busy restaurant, but they should budget at least an hour and a half for each sitting in order to avoid rushing patrons. I speak Spanish proficiently so nothing was lost in translation. I've never experienced such rude service in my life, and it was a shame because up until then the meal had been great.

Came across this place by accident. We were really lucky to get a table as they have full reservation. The price is amazing for 3 courses lunch with drink included!!!!! Fully recommended! But book in advance:)
Food great staff very accomplished

We got a 'Menu del dia' offer with starter, main, desert and 1/2 bottle of wine for 14€ each. There were a few options to choose from for each course. It was a lovely portioned meal. I liked having a menu as a change to Pinxos all the time. The waitress that served us was very friendly, explaining what was in the dishes and the fish of the day.
I would definitely eat there again.
Wonderful selection of Basque and Sapanish dishes. Great value! Cold wine and cold water. We enjoyed our meal very much.
Our starter was nice, but the main course (a burrito like thing) was nothing special. The waiter did not speak English, so you won't get a lot of help translating the menu.

Trato muy agradable y rápido 
Oferta muy variada , pintxos excepcionales bien hechos , menú todos los días . Precios asequibles . Ascensor para el comedor . Acceso silla de ruedas . No dejar de visitar
El trato ha sido increíble, muy atentos y amables. Pero cuando nos han traído la comida, aún mejor. Comida muy buena y en raciones excelentes. Volveremos seguro
Well located in Bilbao city centre. Good food at reasonable prices but very long time waiting for dessert and coffee (horrible coffee but being Italian I'm very picky on this subject).

DO NOT GO THERE 
The fish they gave us was out of date! The meat was hard and there was literally two slices of potatoe to accompaign it, I do not recommend this place
The only good thing was the entry I took and the dessert
Even the waiter seemed like he didnt care

The food was great. We had a set meal and there was lots of variety and typical Basque choices for the 13 EUR it cost. Some of the waiters seemed a bit indifferent though, but the atmosphere was nice.
It's cheap but the food is eatable, nothing more.
A good choice to eat at old village
Ok but not exceptional for the price. Restaurant was empty. Really old school setup.

You feel welcome the second you enter Zortziko. The chairs are like thrones and will remind you of French royalty and the back ground music are condusive to great conversation. 
The tasting menu started us off with an exciting garlic soup with mango that was perfectly balanced. They also excelled with the suckling pig and and the wine pairings but the real star of the show. The dish that will remember in a year, that was the ravioli. 
Perfectly slow cooked bacon squares with ravioli that had Apple and cheese and perfectly cleaned the Palet between each bite of pork. 
I can highly recommend this place.

We chose the "A short trip but intense" menu that had a good size for lunch. One from our table had allergies so he got the foi starter. We asked them do do a wine pairing to the menu. First was a Sauterne that complimented the foi perfectly.
The second dish was a cava cream based sause balancing fat from cream,cheese and bacon with the cava and apple sour taste very nice touch. We chose suckling pig that had been long time roasted at low temperature. It was very tender and again a great wine choose that balanced the dish.

Excellent meal with inventive treatment of very good quality ingredients. Good, friendly but unobtrusive service, and good range of Spanish wines.  Would thoroughly recommend.  (PS Not expensive for this quality of cooking.)

Super-pretentious. Can't really fault the food, but it's definitely not good value, not as good as one would expect for the money, and the 60 euros menu will leave you hungry. A place for tourists. Sad really.
